About Me

I am currently a first-year Ph.D student in Georgia Tech. I received my B.S. degree in Computer Science from Shanghai Jiao Tong University in June 2017.

My research interests are in the area of security and privacy, with special emphasis on key extraction and security problems about voice recognition. I proposed a rotation-angle-based algorithm and a roulette algorithm to use geomagnetic field for key extraction. Now I am particularly interested in addressing potential treats in voice recognition systems.

Publications

Fudong Qiu, Zhengxian He, Linghe Kong, Fan Wu, “MAGIK: An Efficient Key Extraction Mechanism Based on Dynamic Geomagnetic Field.” in the Proceedings of IEEE INFOCOM'17, Atlanta, GA, May, 2017

Research Experience

Secret Key Extraction from Indoor Geomagnetic Field

SJTU
2015 to 2016
  • Analyzed the space-varying and time-varying characteristics of indoor geomagnetic field with extensive measurements and observations (Roughly 2000 samples collected by smartphones in a laboratory).
  • Proposed a rotation-angle-based quantification algorithm targeting the time stamp, corresponding to the largest rotational angle of smartphones. This algorithm uses the 3-Dimension information of the magnetic field and has a high bit rate (approximately 200 bit/s).
  • Built MAGIK, a system that can extract the identical secure key between two smartphones under the presence of the malicious eavesdropper, and achieved a high authentication accuracy (91.2%).
  • Implemented the system on Nexus 7. Experiment results confirmed that our system was efficient in key extraction rate and robust in key establishment without additional overhead on mobile devices.
  • Summarized the work into a paper which was accepted in INFOCOM'17.

    • Selected Projects

    Disease Identification Modeling Based on Machine Learning

    SJTU
    2016
  • Devised a composite disease identifying algorithm for condition specific genes by incorporating feature selection, dimensionality reduction and classification (adopting PCA, SVM, etc.).
  • Evaluated with acute myeloid leukemia genomic samples and achieved results with high accuracy (95.5%).

    • Large-Scale Patent Classification

    SJTU
    2016
  • Trained a supervised-learning classification model on 110,000 samples with a feature of 5,000 dimensions using LIBLINEAR. And the training and predicting process are parallelized with OpenMP to speed up.
  • Implemented a Min-Max Modular and gained a high accuracy (92.9%).

    • Android Based Car Controlling

    SJTU
    2015
  • Developed a small car based on SCM MSP430 with a smartphone on it to transmit back real-time video in the front of the car.
  • Built an app on Android to control the car with voice, gestures or buttons.

    • Advanced MIPS CPU Simulator with Multi-Cycle/Pipeline

    SJTU
    2015
  • Devised the simulator of each CPU component (including Memory, ALU, etc.) in C++ and connected them into advanced MIPS CPU simulators with multi-cycle and pipeline.
  • Implemented the multi-cycle CPU Simulator on a Xilinx Experiment Board in Verilog HDL.
